content:
I'm looking for an update on the log crate's maintainers. It is owned by the libs team, however I think only @Ashley Mannix actively works on it still. Unfortunately they don't have access to crates.io actually make a release (as per the comment in https://github.com/rust-lang/log/pull/486#issuecomment-1057440360).

Could the libs team help resolve this issue? Version 0.4.15 has been created last month (https://github.com/rust-lang/log/pull/485), but it's still not on crates.io.
Yeah, Ashley and I were talking about that recently. We were figuring out if we wanted a 'log team' or a more general 'official rust-lang crates team' or something in that direction.

+1 for a log team for a short term solution, I'm willing to join as well. In the long term a subteam of the lib team or a rust-lang (the repo) team or something would be nice. I think socket2 is also a bit "lose" in that sense from any official Rust team. I maintain it myself with a number of contributors as well back, but I don't think I'm a part of any official team.
Could you @Mara , or anyone who is able, publish v0.4.15 for the log crate? Since I imagine setting up a team make take a bit of time
@Ashley Mannix, you should've gotten an invite on crates.io for log now.
@Ashley Mannix any chance you have the chance to make a release?

Hey everyone! :wave: Just a heads up that we're finally pushing out a patch release of the log crate. Test coverage has been slowly but surely improving, but past releases have run into unexpected breakage around the macros. I'll be keeping a close eye on things here and over in the issues repo in case anything goes awry
